title: LC circuits - what happens after switch is closed

content.question: Which statement best describes the behavior of the circuit after the switch is closed?

choices.label: The inductor prevents the movement of charge carriers, so the capacitor remains charged.
The current in the inductor starts at a nonzero value and decreases at a constant rate.
The inductor current increases from zero and asymptotically approaches a constant maximum value.
The amount of net charge on each capacitor plate oscillates between a maximum amount of positive charge and a maximum amount of negative charge of equal magnitude.

content.answer: The amount of net charge on each capacitor plate oscillates between a maximum amount of positive charge and a maximum amount of negative charge of equal magnitude.
